intro: Entadopsis kirkii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, round, yellowish fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
